name: grimly
content:
grimly adverb
(WITHOUT HOPE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is without hope: Companies grimly hang on to markets at negligible profit margins, and finally give up. His assessment of the war is grimly pessimistic.
More examplesFewer examplesHe is grimly realistic about the parks' finances.A Californian grimly observed, "There's no such thing as truth anymore."

grimly adverb
(SERIOUSLY)
in a worried, serious, or sad way: She stared grimly ahead. "We have to get those windows open," I announced grimly to my husband.
More examplesFewer examplesI looked around at the grimly determined faces of the passengers.He nodded grimly and left the room.She closed her eyes grimly and pointed at the table.
